H2883.def: = process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

H3121.def: = wet soil; ◄ moistened because of its proximity to water; ≈ regarded as an obstacle for movement

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4613.def: = a place where one can stand up straight without sinking into mud or water

H4615.def: = a deep place, usually filled with water; ≈ associated with hardship

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3021.def: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H1627.def: = the passage which leads from the back of the mouth of humans in the direction of the lungs; ► internally, it functions as a passageway for food and breath; externally, it is a place around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ associated with food and speaking

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H7231.def: = process by which people, objects, and events increase in number or frequency

H8185.def: = the fine thread-like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6105.def: = state in which humans are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H6789.def: = process by which liquids disappear from existence, as a result of warm weather

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H819.def: = state of being responsible for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H7068.def: = process by which humans or deities experience a sentiment of anger  for the sake of someone else, ◄ because that other person does not receive the attention, commitment, or treatment that they are entitled to

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H7878.def: = action by which humans produce inarticulate sounds expressing distress

H5058.def: = musical instrument with strings, such as a {L:lute<SDBH:כִּנֹּור>} or {L:lyre<SDBH:נֵבֶל>}

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H3468.def: = a state in which a human or deity helps a human in need to be safe / a safe state

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H2916.def: = wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement

H2883.def: = process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H4615.def: = a deep place, usually filled with water; ≈ associated with hardship

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

= water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4688.def: = a very low area of the earth

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H875.def: = hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄  usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally-occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded  as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life

H332.def: = to isolate part of the body so that nothing can go in or out

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H4116.def: = action by which humans or deities act without delay

H7126.def: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6299.def: = causative action by which humans exchange animals or other humans by substituting them with money or with an(other) animal, ► as a result of which they will escape death or slavery

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H1322.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3639.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H2781.def: = state in which humans feel shame and humiliation, ◄ due to one's own shortcomings or misfortune and/or contempt from other people

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5136.def: = state in which humans see no way out of a difficult situation, ◄ as a result of a loss of confidence

H6960.def: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H5110.def: = process by which objects shake or move back and forth ◄ because of being unstable or when agitated by an outside force

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H5162.def: = causative action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1267.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth; ≈ associated with special occasions such as mourning or sickness

H7219.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H2558.def: = sour alcoholic liquid; ◄ by-product of {L:grape wine<SDBH:יַיִן>} and {L:date-wine<SDBH:שֵׁכָר>}, due to acetous fermentation when it has been in contact with open air longer than necessary; ► used in diluted form as dip for bread, but to be avoided by Nazirites because of the alcohol; very unpleasant when it comes in contact with (bad) teeth and open wounds

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H6772.def: = state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

4.gl: to break (someone's) heart > to cause profound grief

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H6341.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H2821.def: = process by which the light gradually disappears, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars can no longer reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, death, and lack of enlightenment

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H4571.def: = causative action by which deities cause the loins of humans shake

H8210.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H2740.def: = process by which objects become extremely dry ► and therefore highly inflammable

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H5381.def: = action by which humans succeed to catch up with other humans after having pursued them

H2918.def: = community area of tents or other shelters, sometimes encircled by a barrier such as a stone wall, ► where a pastoral or nomadic people live; ≈ a more temporary and less populated settlement than a town

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4341.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H2491.def: = state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H3510.def: = state in which humans are physically wounded

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H8426.def: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6499.def: = young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such

H7160.def: = process by which an object appears to emit light

H6035.def: = state of persons who are suffering and unable to help themselves ◄ because of their own need or status, or the result of someone else's behavior ≈ often used positively of persons who are sincere and not arrogant in their behavior

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H615.def: = person who is locked up in a prison or other location where one does not have the freedom to act and go at will

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H3063.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Leah<SDBH:לֵאָה>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of {L:Solomon<SDBH:שְׁלֹמֹה>}, and, after the exile, a separate administrative district

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

71.dom: Names of People|Names of Groups|Names of Locations
